article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

There is no respite in selling pressure in the market as FM Arun Jaitley continues his Budget speech. The Sensex is down 316.63 points or 1.4 percent at 22837.67 and the Nifty down 95.70 points or 1.4 percent at 6934.05. About 764 shares have advanced, 1388 shares declined, and 135 shares are unchanged.

M&M is up 2 percent.


Here are few Budget proposals

To adhere to fiscal deficit target of FY17
Fiscal deficit target at 3.5%
15.3% increase in plan expenditure
Non-plan expenditure at Rs 14.28 lk cr
2.5% revenue deficit target for FY16 versus budgeted estimates of 2.8%
To do away with plan & non-plan classification from FY18
New companies will not be allowed to seek any exemption
New manufacturing companies after March 1, 2016 to be taxed at 25% plus cess and surcharge
Accelerated depreciation limited for research and development to 150% from FY18
Accelerated depreciation limited to 40% from FY18
Raise personal I-T house rent exemption to Rs 60,000 from Rs 24,000/yr
